name: places/ChIJgXWZmHVZwokR8wGtZTtsGIo
adrFormatAddress: 268 1st Ave., New York, NY 10009-2629, USA

originalText.text: I went there years ago and it was absolutely awful.  I decided to give a try again and so glad I did .  The new staff is amazing Patty is my go to and Betty is also amazing, Rita and Helen too.  I highly recommend.

text.text: I went there years ago and it was absolutely awful.  I decided to give a try again and so glad I did .  The new staff is amazing Patty is my go to and Betty is also amazing, Rita and Helen too.  I highly recommend.

originalText.text: Gel manicure literally peeling off my full finger after only 2 days !!!! Not sure if it is the staff or low quality products but def not coming back

text.text: Gel manicure literally peeling off my full finger after only 2 days !!!! Not sure if it is the staff or low quality products but def not coming back

originalText.text:
I've been here before. Had a bad experience last time but decided to give it another shot since it was open the earliest in the neighborhood that day and maybe I just came on an off day beforehand. Well, So I thought.

I waited outside with one of the employees for about fifteen minutes. She assured me someone was on the way to open shop.
The woman (I'm guessing the manager) that has the key to open was on the phone standing a couple feet away from the store on a phone call with no urgency to get off. She finally finished and opens the door. She was immediately  unwelcoming, unapologetic, and was not friendly at all.

I got a spa pedicure which the massage was horrendous. Followed by a nail polish change... No cuticle cut, no file, nothing - a literal old nail polish off and new nail polish on which was $3 less than a manicure?

Even though this place would be the most convenient salon for me to be a regular, I literally refuse and walk a couple blocks more for better service.

I got a spa pedicure which the massage was horrendous. Followed by a nail polish change... No cuticle cut, no file, nothing - a literal old nail polish off and new nail polish on which was $3 less than a manicure?

Even though this place would be the most convenient salon for me to be a regular, I literally refuse and walk a couple blocks more for better service.

originalText.text: I was skeptical because of the reviews but truly it was a great experience. I got a dip powder with 3 extensions for $54, which is rare considering the extensions. The nail tech Karen worked very well and took her time, but not extremely long as in other places where you just want to leave already. She fixed a broken nail I had and ensured I was pleased with the color, shape, and size. She was very professional, respectful, and truly served me. I only had about a 10-15 minute wait which I was informed of ahead of time. The whole nail process was about an hour, and my nails came out beautiful! I would definitely recommend Karen to anyone.

originalText.text: I’ve been coming here regularly for two years and have always had an excellent experience. I’ve had regular and gel pedicures, powder gel and regular gel manicures and tips. Karen is wonderful and Helen does an amazing job too!
